physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. A was described as having extreme regressive behavior, walking around nude, conversing with 'God', lying on the floor, wandering aimlessly, eating sloppily, and being unable to comprehend questions and directions.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Mr. A was readmitted 5 months later with chronic urinary retention due to phenothiazines but recovered from that problem and continued to show manic behavior. After prescribing lithium carbonate, he gradually settled down.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ms. B was diagnosed as having hysterical psychosis and presented with talkative, manic behavior, pacing, and not sleeping.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Ms. B was discharged after treatment with lithium carbonate and continued to function adequately with only minor relapses.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ms. C displayed euphoric, expansive behavior, with flight of ideas, and some paranoia toward her stepmother.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Ms. C was diagnosed with schizo-affective psychosis and after receiving treatment, she gradually improved, with no mood swings 6 months after discharge.
